definitions.definition: very famous and talked about a lot by people

examples.text: Her patience and tact are legendary.
His dedication and charity had made him a legendary figure.
We once received a visit from the legendary Orson Welles.

definitions.definition: mentioned in stories from ancient times

wordOrigin: early 16th cent. (as a noun denoting a collection of legends, especially of saints' lives): from medieval Latin legendarius, from legenda ‘things to be read’, from Latin legere ‘read’.
